sense.name: free (from restraint), let loose
sense.commentary: Includes: LOOSE OFF Syntax Is: NP1[agent] LOOSE NP2
sense.examples: Bush and his neocon allies have loosed the dogs of war. My sons loosed the dogs from the slips. German surface raiders loosed mines off South Australia. The Germans had loosed the plague on the United States. It was the pilots, not our boys, who loosed off their guns in the lounge of the plane.

sense.name: (cause to) be loose
sense.commentary: Syntax Includes: NP1[agent] LOOSE NP2 NP1 LOOSE
sense.examples: Feltram loosed the rope and shoved the boat off. The tree was bent down again and the noose loosed.
